¡MÁS!.desc: ¡MÁS! is a media club that captures a variety of stories about Mexican American culture, including academics, athletics, politics,  entertainment, and more. ¡MÁS! is an inclusive club for all Gunn students, and all are welcome. Activities include an online newspaper, guest speakers, and other socially-distanced fun.

131111 (Creek Cleaning).desc: A club dedicated for cleaning creeks through independent events and/or our creek segment at Barron Creek near Sofia University (can give volunteer hours). Miscellaneous activities for creek cleaning include removing graffiti, picking up litter, and enjoying being outside.

3D Printing and Design Club.desc: The 3D Printing and Design club will allow students to learn about design through CAD and rapid prototyping, as well as creating physical prototypes.

A Cappella Club.desc: The Gunn A Cappella Club shares the joy of singing to all interested members of the Gunn community! At our weekly meetings, members participate in musical activities and rehearsals to prepare for performances at TEDx, Open Mic and more. During distance learning, we are looking forward to creating exciting music videos and compilations. Join the Titones to make music through the sole power of voices! (And if you can’t carry a tune, be our beatboxer!)

Acts of Random Kindness Club.desc: We promote and spread kindness throughout the year at Gunn through multiple events such as Finals Care Packages, Cuties for Cuties, and an Easter Egg Hunt. We're a low pressure and chill club for a good time and to help spread kindness!

Aeronautical, Naval, and Automotive Asso.desc: A club for the discussion of technical details and history of all vehicles that take to the land, air, and sea. Members can sign up to present a topic of their choosing (whether it be a ship, piece of equipment, or design trend) that will be opened up to discussion for other club members. We hope to be holding movie nights and other such events throughout the year.

Aeronautics Association.desc: This year, I believe we would mostly teach our club members about physics in space and some more niche topics as well as introduce them to Computer-Aided Design (CAD). We might also guide the members to small projects of their own for them to work on while they are stuck at home.

AI4Girls.desc: Join our community of coding and artificial intelligence (AI) enthusiasts! Whether you are just beginning or already experienced, this club will be a place for you to learn, share and create! This year, we will be exploring AI and machine learning through making mobile apps. You will have the opportunity to work on personal apps/AI projects with like-minded peers, and gain the resources and support to prototype your app. If you don’t have experience, don’t worry! we’ll cover topics such as AI, UI design and app coding from the basics. We will also hold discussions for everyone to participate & share resources. Let’s build an inclusive and welcoming community which we can all access and contribute to.  We will also hear from guest speakers, and potentially organize hackathons as a club! The possibilities are endless…

American Cancer Society.desc: American Cancer Society aims to educate the Gunn community about cancer and the latest cancer research, organize and host cancer awareness events, and promote cancer volunteer opportunities (such as Relay for Life and Making Strides Against Breast Cancer) with the purpose of purpose of reducing total cancer incidence and mortality by cutting it off at the source through education and support. ACS also plans to have qualified guest speakers visit and deliver informative presentations at meetings. While these are weekly and monthly goals, the club’s long-term goals are to deepen students’ understanding of cancer while keeping them updated on the most recent cancer events and research so that ACS can ignite in students the desire to learn more about cancer and even potentially, inspire them to pursue a career or studies in oncology, as well.

Amnesty Club.desc: Amnesty Club is Gunn's student group for Amnesty International, a human rights organization founded in 1961. The club participates in nation and world wide human rights campaigns and events as part of the Amnesty organization. Members also discuss and learn about issues and current events pertaining to human rights both modeling after Amnesty and on our own. Join to be a part of the  country's largest human rights group and get involved in some of the world's biggest human rights events!

Applications of Computer Science.desc: Applications of Computer Science is a place for students who are passionate about real-life applications of Computer Science—like app development, website development, and more. Our purpose is to collaborate, discuss ideas, explore the world of real-life applications of Computer Science, learn to implement our ideas, and appreciate the abundance of places that Computer Science can take us. An example of an activity we will enjoy is talking with professionals (like softwareengineers, existing app programmers, professors, etc) and having them help us advance our skills and knowledge of what we are able to do.

Asian Traditional Culture Club.desc: The Asian Traditional Culture club is designed for Gunn Students to increase enthusiasm and enhance the knowledge about the Traditional Asian Culture. We are going to introduce some traditional Asian customs, performing arts, crafts and foods. We will provide opportunities to DIY some crafts and also try delicious Asian Foods!

ASL Club.desc: ASL Club is an inclusive space where students of all levels of experience can learn and practice American Sign Language (ASL). Come enjoy fun activities, vocabulary-building, and silent conversations! With a bit of weekly commitment, all members will achieve some level of proficiency in ASL by the end of the year. This club is open to anyone interested in mastering this useful, unique skill!

Best Buddies Club.desc: The Best Buddies Club provides a welcoming environment for students with disabilities at Gunn. Club members can hang out or do group activities with their buddy partner (Futures Students) and strengthen their relationships or build new friendships. Throughout the school year, we will participate in fundraisers and events, such as the Best Buddies Walk!

Bikex Club.desc: Our club is focused on supporting the SVBE organization and growing the pastime of biking. We will do so by fundraising and raising awareness of SVBX and what they do. In addition we will create an opportunity for cycling enthusiasts to get together and discuss their interests. As a part of these goals we will plan and carry out events such as bike drives.

Biotechnology Club.desc: Biotechnology is the future. The mission of this club is to excite and empower Gunn students to have an impact in the world with biotechnology. The short term goals are teaching students about the applications of biotechnology and the role they can play in this field. The long term objective is to have a thriving club that will help build future scientists who can have an exciting career in the field of biotechnology.We will offer weekly educational series that introduce different aspects of biotechnology through various mediums - videos, interactive discussions and individual/team activities including field trips. We will also invite guest speakers from the industry to share their journey and experiences.

Bridge Club.desc: We play the most fun card game ever: Bridge!

Canway Youth.desc: Canway youth provides opportunities for adolescents to reach their potential by participating and getting recognized for community service work, achieve higher academic success through subject specific study and classic books reading groups, and balance school and life through social opportunities with other club members.

Cash Club Corp.desc: Cash Club Corp at Gunn is one of the most welcoming communities for students looking to learn and practice finance, economics, discuss current events in business. They will learn basic financial concepts through an easy to learn curriculum, learn about basic economics, as well as participate in fun and engaging activities pertaining to business management Members will have the opportunity to interact with business professionals and gain a headstart in their potential careers.

Chamber Music Club.desc: The goal of the Chamber Music Club is to bring both members and community joy through group music making. The club activities includes playing/performing music with others in their own groups. Our main activity is presenting and educating about famous musicians, ethnomusicology, and many more. Non-musicians are also welcome as musicians perform to educate one another regardless of proficiency.

Chess Club.desc: Chess club is a place for chess players of all skills and grades to come together and have fun playing chess.

Chinese Culture Club.desc: Want to learn more about Chinese culture while getting extra credit for Chinese class? Join Chinese Culture Club! Every week, we will have culture presentations and fun games to play. When in-person school resumes, there will also be snacks! At the end of the year, the Chinese Culture club also holds a ceremony that honors students in Chinese level three and above to the National Chinese Honor Society.

Christian Club.desc: The purpose of the Gunn Christian Club is to create a Christian community on the Gunn campus. We hold weekly meetings to deepen our faith, grow closer as a Christian community, and build each other up. We also participate in national and international Christian events, such as See You At The Pole and donations through the program Operation Christmas Child.

Climbing Club.desc: We talk about all kinds of climbing topics ranging from techniques to climbing news to amazing climbs. Come and meet other Gunn climbers!

Coding Art Club.desc: The Coding Art Club brings a new form of creativity to the Gunn community by combining art and computer science. We will explore coding generative art with libraries like p5.js, three.js, and processing. During club meetings, we will have live coding demos, as well as mini group projects and presentations for members. No coding experience is required! Join us! :)

College Prep Club (CPC).desc: C.P.C is a club designed to prepare students for Gunn classes and college through fun activities, guest speakers, fundraisers, and more. Our aim is to provide more information and resources to help decrease stress that often emerges with school and the college preparation process. Our main focus will be targeted towards lower classmen, while upperclassmen will get the chance to build our foundation and mentor younger students.

Competitive Programming Club.desc: In Gunn Competition Programming Club, we teach students programming algorithms and languages. We motivate and train students to solve problems with their programming skills and participate in prestigious competitive programming contests, such as USACO, Codeforces, PicoCTF, and local programming competitions. We plan on hosting a programming competition for middle and high schoolers in the spring. During club time, we share knowledge and have fun with our club members!

Cooking and Baking Club.desc: The Cooking and Baking Club's mission is to bring people together through food. At meetings we will do some simple Cooking or Baking to always end up with a tasty lunch. Members will also get the chance to share their favorite recipes and try them out with the group. Hop in and you will see how amazing it is to enjoy food that you made! No prior experience is necessary.

Cryptology Club.desc: Learn how to make and break secret codes and ciphers. Participate in online cryptology competitions, including the one hosted by our club: http://greatcipherchallenge.org. Check out our club website at tinyurl.com/gunncryptologyclub

Culture Connection Club.desc: We translate school news and documents into 5 languages (Chinese, Korean, Japanese, French, Spanish) to make them more accessible to the Gunn community (students, parents, etc.). We are looking for translators — if you speak or take a second language at Gunn and need community service hours, we encourage you to join us! At club meetings, we learn about different cultures and languages through food and fun activities (such as Kahoot, learning how to make a cultural dish).

Data Science Club.desc: Data science club will be dedicated to learning about machine learning and data mining to create meaningful projects. Through python tools and libraries, we will explore the use of machine learning and its applications. Finally, at the end of the year, we hope to create research that we might submit for publication.

Dream Volunteers Club.desc: Dream Volunteers Club partners with the NGO Dream Volunteers to connect with the network of Young Dreamer students around the world who do sustainable volunteer work in their communities. We do local service work, both during and outside of meetings, and make cross cultural connections by sending and receiving videos from Dreamers abroad. We are part of the network of 15+ DV Clubs in the Bay Area and will be organizing service projects with them as well. Our members have created their own changemaker projects that we work to support! Join us to make a change in your local community and get connected to and inspired by changemakers around the world!

Economics Club.desc: Come to this club to discuss notable economic ideas, great economic thinkers, and current events related to the economy. The club is open to all people, whether or not they have had experience with the subject. In addition, if interest is sufficient, members of the club may participate in the National Economics Challenge (online this year).

Environmental Technology.desc: This club is focused on increasing awareness of environmental issues and discussing the application of technology to curb our carbon footprint. We will brainstorm solutions to solve climate change through technology and implement our ideas to make the school cleaner. If you are interested in learning and helping the Earth through computer science, this club is for you!

eSports Club.desc: The Gunn eSports Club is a club that will act as a network for Gunn high school students who enjoy video games, focusing on improving members and encouraging students to get into more serious competition while playing with and against each other. Specifically during meetings, we will watch and discuss professional eSports matches. As a club, we hope to remove the negative prejudices and stereotypes around video games and showcase the benefits that video games can bring, such as a sense of community, through supporting charities through methods such as donating tournament prize pools.

Ethics Bowl Club.desc: Interested in ethical issues? Well then maybe you’d find a place at Gunn Ethics Bowl Club. Don’t have a lot of experience talking about ethics? Don’t worry about it, neither do we. Experienced in talking about ethics? Please join, we need you. During club meeting we’ll talk about, you guessed it, ethics. Eventually we even plan to compete in the National High School Ethics Bowl (whow how ambitious), but until then Gunn ethics club is your place to talk to your peers about pressing issues of the current day.

Everyday AI.desc: The purpose of my club is to inform people about this new topic in the tech world called artificial intelligence. My club will explore real world AI problems and implementations. We will have thorough discussions about the positives and negatives about AI as a whole and certain real world implementations of AI. We will also look at possible future opportunities of AI in the tech world. Along with talking about these topics, my club will also bring in people who have dedicated their whole life on AI.

Film Club.desc: Film Club’s purpose is to provide a safe and inclusive environment for Gunn students to express their creativity through video and learn about filmmaking outside of an official class. Film Club strives to create a community for the filmmakers of Gunn to express their creativity and share their knowledge and experience with other students. Film Club will work to achieve its goals by effectively making use of club meeting times to plan out our activities and projects. Each week, Film Club will meet to discuss a video-related topic, plan a project, or engage in another activity arranged by the club president. Film Club plans to have one large project per semester, to be determined by the club and open to all club members to help plan and execute to completion.

Forensics Club.desc: Our clubs purpose is to provide information to people interested in forensics through information presentations, interesting case studies, virtual labs, virtual simulations, and guest speakers. This club will teach people about the different fields of forensics, numerous career pathways within its scope, and resources on universities/opportunists that provide additional classes or courses about forensics.

French Club/ National French Honor Socie.desc: French Club is open to all students who are interested in the French Language and the francophone world. The club aims to spread and educate students on French culture, including food, language, and holidays. Throughout the year, we will be hosting several events including french film viewings, crêpe tastings (when possible), cheese tastings (when possible), etc. The National French Honor Society meets jointly with the French Club and includes selected French Club members.

Friends Club.desc: Our mission is to bring people together and create a fun and welcoming environment that promotes inclusivity and friendship. In addition, we will watch the popular TV show "Friends", which will give everyone a chance to relax and take a break from the stress of school.

Game Design Club.desc: The game design club focuses on the design and development process of making games. Join us regardless if you how to code, draw, or honestly if you're just interested in the creative process behind designing games.

Genetics Club.desc: The Genetics Club invites anyone who is interested in learning about the study of heredity and the variation of inherited characteristics. Our club aims to foster an interest in genetics and genetic engineering through fun games, hands-on projects, and presentations. We hope to inform members on both the science behind genetic engineering, but also the ethics and controversial decisions that come along with it. No prior experience is necessary.

GENUp PAUSD.desc: GENUp PAUSD is an educational advocacy club that focuses on ensuring that student voice is heard within education. As a club, our plan is to host webinars with local officials, write petitions and policy proposals for the School Board, and work with the statewide organization to sponsor educational advocacy campaigns. Some examples of our past activities include hosting a webinar with Author Julie Lythcott-Haims, making calls to get AB331 (the Ethnic Studies graduation requirement) passed through the Assembly, and working with Vote16PA on creating a candidate questionnaire for the 2020 local elections.

German Club.desc: The Gunn German Club is for anyone interested in preserving german culture on campus. The club organizes a variety of activities and events for students interested in all things german. For example, we play authentic German games, listen to German music, and eat/make delicious German food. We also offer induction into the National German Honor Society for members who meet the qualifications. The club promotes campus-wide World Language events, such as movie nights and International Week, and actively participates in these events. The Gunn German Club offers a safe and welcoming environment for all students to explore different cultures in a fun, interactive, and friendly way.

Girls Tech Club.desc: Our mission is to create a community for women to explore and pursue computer science and technology. We foster a community of high school girls passionate about technology and give them a place to freely explore their interests. We also promote technology to younger girls in local elementary and middle schools to narrow the gender gap in the tech industry.

Green Team.desc: Gunn's leading environmental club, providing opportunities for education, volunteering, leadership, and activism. Meeting at lunches to explore legislature, ongoing crises, and overall environmental education both locally and globally.

GSA (Gender and Sexuality Alliance).desc: The GSA exists to create a safe and welcoming community here at Gunn for anyone in the LGBTQ+ community. Through this club, we hope to connect students here at Gunn High School to other groups and organizations that support the LGBTQ+ Community, and to help foster a welcoming community here at Gunn. This club will also create school-wide events to bridge the gap of understanding in hopes to destigmatize any misleading connotations or ideas about the LGBTQ+ Community.

Gunn Med Club.desc: The main goal of our club Gunn Med is to provide students with knowledge about the different aspects and careers in the medical field in an interesting and interactive way. There are many medical careers in the world that many students may not know of, and our most important goal is to let these students know of the career paths they can choose to pursue in the future. By informing these students, we can help them learn more about themselves, as well as help them decipher which medical career they are most interested in studying. Our club will provide an educational opportunity to dig into the field of medicine and help confirm the member’s interests to pursue a career related to medicine.

Gunn ML.desc: Artificial intelligence and machine learning is drastically changing the way people interact with the world. Rather than broad computer science, Gunn AI focuses specifically on the fundamental algorithms of artificial intelligence. This club will primarily focus on building, learning about, and teaching various concepts of AI and machine learning to students. We will also have occasional guest speakers talk about where AI is headed next and it's applications in the modern world. This club is open to people with all levels of experience with the main goal of learning from each other. Whether you're new to computer science as a whole, or new to the topic of AI, this club will be a great place for you to learn about one of the fastest growing fields in computer science.

Harry Potter Club.desc: This club is a place for Harry Potter fans to get together and discuss the subject. It is also a place to introduce those unfamiliar with the Magical World into it. The club's activities will include, but are not limited to, discussions over topic questions, plot review, theories, and movie watchings. Everyone is welcome!

Health Club.desc: Our overarching goal is to help the Gunn community become more aware of how nutrition and fitness contribute to our physical and mental health, as well as factors like the environment and animal welfare. Topics we may cover are protein sources, micro and macronutrients, myths, and truths surrounding plant-based diets, etc.We plan on achieving our purpose through pre-recorded podcasts which members can listen to on their own time (while taking a walk!) and group discussions. We also will hold fitness competitions, group online workout sessions, synchronous cooking activities, and share recipes and tips over social media accounts.

Helios Magazine Club.desc: The Helios Magazine is a club open to all Gunn students who are interested in contributing to a professional and meaningful publication on campus, whether through art, design, or writing. We will work on distributing an entertaining, interesting, and thought-provoking magazine online every other month, while teaching members the importance of ethical journalism and creative, professional writing. All welcome!

Hip Hop Club.desc: Hip Hop club offers a space where students interested in urban dance, specifically hip hop dance, can feel comfortable expressing themselves, dancing, improving their ability, and meeting like-minded people. Members will learn choreos, develop their own dance style, and hopefully eventually create choreography of their own. Hip Hop club is open and welcoming to students of all skill level and interest, as our central goal is to create not just dancers, but community.

HOSA.desc: Gunn HOSA is a medical club that is affiliated with the HOSA Future Health Professionals organization. We practice and participate in HOSA competitions and invite guest speakers in the medical field.

Internet of Titans.desc: The goal of our club is to expose club members to various current trending technologies. Further, we hope to develop a culture within our club that promotes positive learning habits and the idea of community while learning. We hope to use our club as an opportunity to further reinforce each other's understanding of technology while providing a positive impact on the Gunn community.

Interscholastic Gaming League.desc: IGL provides a place to relax and unwind after a hard week full of stress. We do this by chatting about or playing video games together.

Japanese Culture Club.desc: The purpose of the Japanese Culture Club is to educate students about the many aspects of Japanese Culture. We want to put a large focus on Japanese traditions, history, and present-day pop culture, and how those have affected our own society as well. Overall, our main goal is to teach the rich culture of this amazing country to all students who find it fascinating!

K-Pop Dance Club.desc: Welcome to the K-Pop dance club! Every K-Pop song has a specific dance that goes with it. We don't have official dance experience; we're all beginners! We accept all skill levels (even if you haven't danced before in your life.) We will learn K-Pop dances, starting with easier ones, and gradually learning the harder ones as the year goes on. Again, we are all beginners and will work together to learn the dances!

Key Club.desc: Gunn Key Club is part of the world's largest and oldest student run service organization. As the high school sector of Kiwanis Club, Gunn Key Club works to engage students in community service events and build connections with fellow Key Clubbers in their area. As a member of Gunn Key Club, you'll be provided with many different opportunities to serve your community and have fun along the way!

Learning Through Entrepreneurship.desc: The goal of this club is to encourage students with existing ideas to further develop these ideas into companies. Students will be given the ability to collaborate with other students, giving feedback and fine-tuning their companies. Students will then be encouraged to enter their companies into various competitions, ranging from local to national level competitions.

Lifestyle club.desc: The Gunn Lifestyle Club is meant to help improve students' overall lifestyle and outlook on life. Our plan is to talk about topics such as mental health, harmful habits, physical fitness, eating stigma and healthy eating, motivation/attitude, and more. We’ll be showing demonstrations like how to prepare healthy snacks in club meetings and students can choose whether or not they want to participate although we’ll highly encourage them to do so. Before each club meeting, we will post what topics we will cover so if a certain student doesn’t feel comfortable attending they can choose not to. We also are planning on having guest speakers come in like counselors and nutritionists so that people can hear tips from a professional point of view. We really would love to start this club because we both wish we had something like this to help guide us during the pandemic.

March for Our Lives.desc: March For Our Lives promotes gun control as a way to prevent gun violence. The organization specifies its goals in a peace plan using the CHANGE acronym. Change the standards of gun ownershipHalve the rate of gun deaths in 10 yearsAccountability for the gun lobby and industryName a Director of Gun Violence PreventionGenerate community-based solutionsEmpower the next generation.

Math Circle.desc: We seek to promote an appreciation and understanding of math beyond the typical high school curriculum by hosting weekly talks, in-house contests, games, and guest speakers. We also help students prepare for and participate in many contests throughout the year, with a focus on math competitions such as AMC, HMMT, and BMT.

Medcorps.desc: Medcorps is a club that provides opportunities for students that are interested in the medical field. Throughout the year there will be professional talks, career guidance workshops, clinical care, research and internship opportunities, as well as, hands-on demonstrations. Medcorps will help students find external programs and their own passion for medicine. Medcorps holds activities and provides volunteer hours.

Mock Trial.desc: Mock Trial provides an opportunity for students to learn about the legal system and apply their knowledge by working together to research a hypothetical case. In tournaments, students will role play as attorneys, witnesses, or other court members and gain a thorough understanding of trial preparation, court procedures, and legal advocacy.

Model United Nations.desc: Gunn Model UN strives to promote public speaking, politics, and diplomacy in student life. When attending a number of conferences each year, delegates will represent a country or person while discussing a specific issue. The club also offers many leadership opportunities and provides a wonderful community for students to make new friends. Most years, we travel to Hawaii, Washington DC, Berkeley, and many other places.

Mural Club.desc: The overall goal of our club is to eventually impact and inform the community who sees our murals. To make this happen, every week we would form ideas/smaller murals/sketches of possible projects we can do. We would also re-evaluate the events that have happened in the world and in our country, state, and town in the past week to come up with more ideas for murals. Using all the ideas we generate every week, we would make at least one mural a month. We would also like to make murals about not only events, but holidays and special months that are dedicated to certain ethnic groups.

Music Society.desc: Gunn Music Society fosters a community of Gunn students who enjoy all different genres of music. Every meeting will consist of music-related games and activities and listening to music together. We hope to introduce new musical genres to our members and celebrate music through fun and exciting activities. Some games we have planned include “Finish the Lyric” and “Name That Song,” among many others. Our meetings will take place every other Monday during lunch.

Muslim Student Association.desc: Gunn Muslim Student Association (MSA) is a community for people of all backgrounds to collaborate and learn, build meaningful relationships, break stereotypes, spread awareness, and celebrate diversity.

Mythology Club.desc: The Mythology Club meets to learn about and discuss all kinds of world mythology!

National Art Honor Society.desc: National Art Honor Society is for anyone who is interested and curious about the many different art forms available, both in the context of history and modern trends. There will be fun art projects, art history presentations, games, as well as occasional community service and fundraising opportunities. This club is open to people of all skill levels and aims to be a welcoming and safe environment to create art and meet other creative individuals!

Neuroscience Club.desc: The Neuroscience Club invites people interested in the workings of the brain and nervous system: how we are enabled to think and act in particular ways. In this club, members will learn about the interdisciplinary field of neuroscience--including topics such as molecular biology, anatomy, and psychology--through presentations, activities, and games. Members will also be exposed to careers in this field, as well as related opportunities. No prior experience is necessary.

Organic Garden Club.desc: The Gunn Organic Garden Club grows and harvests food that benefits Gunn's cooking and culture classes. We aim to educate students about environmental issues with a hands-on experience. Activities include weeding, planting, harvesting, using plants in creative ways, and learning about the plants we grow from club officers, teacher supervisors, and guest speakers.

P.A.A.S (Plant Based Animal Activist Soc.desc: Throughout this semester, we will be working towards creating a pamphlet that dives into creating a more eco-friendly environment. By exploring topics such as reducing one’s carbon footprint with their diet, we will create an educational pamphlet on being sustainable in Palo Alto. We’ll also be watching many fun movies and playing kahoots, and quizizz together.  Feel free to simply drop by and just hang out with friends while playing fun trivia.

Pandora's Box Creative Magazine.desc: Pandora's Box is Gunn's student-run literary magazine, containing original poetry, short stories, photographs, and artwork. We compose, compile, and celebrate the creative works of Gunn High School's students. We provide an opportunity for creative expression in a safe and encouraging environment. The group will participate in weekly meetings, taking place every Monday, where members will take part in writing or other creative activities and help plan the magazine. Fundraisers will occur at least once a semester. Funds go towards printing and publishing costs. Two issues will be published during the year, one each semester.

Paper Airplanes Club.desc: The Gunn Paper Airplanes Club has three main purposes: 1. Help conflict-affected high school students to improve their English to increase their future opportunities. 2.Increase compassion in high school students by connecting them with peers from different backgrounds. 3. Provide a voice for conflict-affected high school students. Committed club members have the opportunity to be matched individually to conflict-affected high school students to tutor them in English online. All club members will work together to create at least one informational event during the second semester consisting of an educational panel about topics relating to the club.

PC Building Club.desc: PCB will help students understand what role each computer component has in order to make a functioning pc that can perform various tasks. We will also teach students how to build their own PCs.

Philosophy Club.desc: Is there any significance to life? Why should we care about how our actions affect others?  How do we know if an action is good or bad? It’s no surprise that philosophical questions like these have roamed great minds over thousands of years. At philosophy club, we will learn and discuss some of the oldest and most controversial philosophical questions, thought experiments, and ethical theories. The club is discussion based, so members will drive the direction of topics that we examine. We would love to hear how you would answer life’s questions - we hope to see you in the club!

Physics and Astronomy Club.desc: The main focus of this club will be on Astrophysics, but we will also discuss topics in the field of basic newtonian physics and particle physics as well. If you have absolutely no knowledge of physics, you are still more than welcome to join; we will first go over basic physics. Activities will include discussions and optional mini-projects. There will also be designated time for members to get to know each other since we no longer have much opportunity to socialize and meet new people due to the pandemic. Meetings will be held once a week at most.

Physics Club.desc: Gunn Physics Club will have lessons on current physics course content and other topics not covered in Gunn's courses. We will provide members the opportunity to review for their physics classes, attempt more challenging questions, study for AP exams, and learn about other interesting areas of physics. We will primarily meet during lunch, but additional meetings will be held based on demand. If any members want help preparing for the F=ma and USA Physics Olympiad exams, the president previously placed in the top 80 of USAPHO and can give advice and lessons outside of club minutes.

Civil and Political Discourse.desc: To close the partisan gap and highlight youth voices on the nations issues and create long term pathways to bridge the gap between politicians and teens across the political spectrum.

Polymer Clay Club.desc: Gunn PCC is dedicated to sharing the polymer clay medium with the Gunn community! We work on creating miniature models of things like food and characters from Pokemon. No prior experience is necessary and it's a great way to relieve stress! You never know if you'll find your inner peace while making miniature boba models.

Powerlifting/Weightlifting Club.desc: This club will either introduce the importance and meaning of powerlifting/weightlifting, or it will help experienced students improve upon and sharpen their weight/powerlifting skills. The main point of this club is to motivate and help students along their journey of power and weightlifting. Whether it's emotional or physical help, this club will talk about the different techniques and different mentalities to have in mind while embarking on the exciting journey in the power/weightlifting realm. The main activities will include weekly discussions regarding technique, form, nutrition, and many more topics. Along with weekly discussions, we will also try to have weekly lifting sessions at the Gunn Titan Gym.

Project QUERB.desc: Project QUERB invites anyone interested in the fundamental physics behind our world at the smallest scale, or quantum mechanics. Members are exposed to this radically unique and exciting field, and can build an in-depth understanding of it, through presentations, activities, and mentoring by professionals in the field. We work towards conducting our annual, groundbreaking quantum physics experiment, such as implementing Shor’s Algorithm or experimenting with circular polarization.

Psychology Club.desc: Gunn psych club is a student-led community dedicated to the learning of the human mind.

Puzzles Club.desc: Puzzle lovers unite! In the puzzles club, we discuss and solve interesting word puzzles, logic puzzles, Rebus puzzles, and more. Check us out Fridays at lunch for weekly puzzles and discussions.

Quiz Bowl Club.desc: Gunn Quiz Bowl is a club that allows people to put their general knowledge to the test in a fast-paced head to head competition with buzzers. Topics include history, literature, science, fine arts, current events, popular culture, sports, and much more. Competitions this year will be held at local Bay Area Schools. Whether you want to test your current knowledge of all sorts of topics, or just want to have fun and chill out, Gunn Quiz Bowl is the perfect club!

Reach Out, Care, Know (ROCK).desc: ROCK is dedicated to reducing the stigma surrounding mental health through education, outreach, and events to remind our peers the importance of valuing one's wellness. Additionally, students participate in trainings, so they know how to be a "ROCK" --someone who is able to approach a friend who may be battling a mental health issue, provide support, and connect them to the help they need and deserve.

Red Cross.desc: Volunteer with us to gain service hours during club meetings! We will act as an extension of the local Red Cross chapter, doing mission-related services (such as raising awareness online for disaster preparedness), and organize&participate in a variety of local volunteering opportunities (such as organizing contactless PPE drives, making virtual cards for frontline workers). Once we return in person, we will potentially organize an annual blood drive and teach disaster preparedness at local elementary schools. Club perks include the opportunity to receive free CPR training and certification, access to the Red Cross network, and being officially registered as a Red Cross volunteer! Join us to have fun and make a tangible impact together.

Regency Era Club!.desc: Join the Regency Era club where we will indulge in culture, fashion, literature, films, and more from the Regency Era period! Stop by to watch clips from our favorite regency era films, learn etiquette like ballroom dancing, and talk about how vastly our social norms have changed! Also, if you watched Bridgerton you should definitely join because we will explore everything about it!

Reptile Club.desc: The main purpose of the club is to educate people about reptiles, meet some reptiles, and have fun. I have my own reptiles that I will give talks about over Zoom, and introduce them.  We will discuss and/or debate issues in the reptile community (ie. Should we continue breeding spider ball pythons?). I want to make a space that is inclusive to everyone, and that people can talk about whatever reptiles they want to and get advice and help from others.

Research Science Innovation (RSI).desc: RSI's goal is to provide members with opportunities to delve into the fields of STEM and research, while competing in regional and nation-wide competitions. We provide a space every week to cultivate and develop interests in science, technology, engineering, and math through student presentations and guest speaker appearances. We participate and excel in the TSA Teams competition each year, here we compete in teams to tackle intricate and exciting problems in science and engineering. Anyone interested in STEM, research, or having fun should join!!

Rubik's Cube Club.desc: We talk about all kinds of climbing topics ranging from techniques to climbing news to amazing climbs. Come and meet other Gunn climbers!

SAGE Club.desc: At Students for the Advancement of Global Entrepreneurship" club, we learn to take a startup business and build it up. Every year, we find a problem that needs solving to build a business plan around it. This culminates in our annual SAGE national competition, which will be virtual this coming year. Join us if you building a business excites you

Science Bowl.desc: Gunn Science bowl aims to educate others about and open up opportunities in the STEM field by studying and ultimately attending the National Science Bowl competition under the name of Henry M. Gunn High School. The competition will hopefully serve as a catalyst for exploration, allowing members and participants to gain experience and insight into scientific topics like biology, math and physics, chemistry, and Earth and space science, as well as personal qualities like teamwork, determination, and creativity.

Science Olympiad (previously Science Cir.desc: This club promotes the study of a variety of scientific topics from chemistry to mechanical engineering to prepare members for Science Olympiad competitions.

Sky of Hope.desc: The Sky of Hope Club invites people to come together as a team to help nonprofit organizations and people in need, such as patients of Parkinson’s or Alzheimer’s disease, substance recovery patients, etc. In this club, members will cultivate a passion for helping others and learn about how to offer a helping hand to people in need across the nation. In the long term, the club serves to inspire a generation of compassionate volunteers who not only help their own community, but also reach out to various groups of people across the nation.

Socially Responsible Investment Fund (SR.desc: The purpose of our club is to educate others about the stock market and finance while making realistic choices on a stock market simulator. SRIF also helps people distinguish companies that are socially responsible and that are trying to help society, from others that may not be environmentally conscious or do harm in some kind of way. At the end of the year, the portfolio on the market simulator will show how much we have grown and progressed.

Spanish Club.desc: The Gunn Spanish Club meets weekly to promote Spanish culture and language. Be it food-making, guest speakers, or fun games, the Spanish Club has consistently fostered an environment for members to enjoy and learn all about the Spanish-speaking world. Despite COVID-19, we still plan on having weekly meetings to connect those who love the culture of Spanish-speaking countries! Note: even though the meetings will be held virtually, members still have an opportunity to be admitted into the Spanish National Honor Society!

Speech and Debate.desc: Gunn Speech and Debate is a nationally ranked Club that teaches students how to effective express opinions based off of current events.  Each year we train students to become strong public speakers with the skills and knowledge to effectively win arguments, and compete in prestigious tournaments.

Sports Analytics Club.desc: Over the course of the year, we will learn about and develop computational techniques to analyze various major league sports. We will also go over some of the cutting edge tech that is used to give athletes a competitive advantage in the sports industry. Moreover, our club will invite industry experts from startups and major league sports teams to talk about their experiences in the fascinating field of Sports Analytics. At the end of the year, our aim is to participate in open source data science competitions (such as Kaggles)

Star Wars Club.desc: The Star Wars Club is open to anyone who has an interest in Star Wars, whether it is movies or books, Canon or Legends. We will be watching and discussing Star Wars movies/TV-shows/videos such as The Mandalorian Season 2 (when it comes out). Come join the fun, and May the Force Be With You!

Street Art Club.desc: Street Art Club will serve as a way to create a community for those who like all kinds of art; it will be focused on Public Art and murals, and all levels of skill and interest are welcome! We will talk about street art opportunities and organize zoom art events, and members can learn from their peers about street art! In addition, we may have guest speakers throughout the year.

Surfrider.desc: The Surfrider organization is a nonprofit environmental organization that works to protect the world's oceans and beaches. The purpose of this club here at Gunn would be to spread awareness of human impact on oceans and what we can do as a society and as individuals to help out. The club would meet twice a month to discuss upcoming beach clean ups around Half Moon Bay, as well as educate students on how to reduce one's plastic contribution, and work to make more restaurants in the area environmentally friendly. Some meeting activities include: creating jewelry from trash/plastic we find around campus, creating packages that include environmentally friendly products that can be used in one's day to day life. We would also create educational presentations and include videos and information from the Surfrider website.

TEDxGunnHighSchool.desc: Our mission is to cultivate ideas and conversation through an annually hosted TEDx conference held in Spagenberg Theatre. Our two committees, finance and speakers, work hard each year to improve quality of speakers and quality of experience for all our audience members. The speakers committee works with each speaker individually to write, edit and rehearse each talk. The finance committee raises all funds to cover the cost of a fully fledged TEDx conference. The raising of funds include grants and small fundraisers.It's TEDx, but Gunn.

The Chariot.desc: The Chariot is Gunn's student-led social and political magazine. The Chariot is intended to create and promote political discussion at Gunn and make people aware of issues that matter by showcasing a wide variety of views. We also hold events for political discussion, such as political forums. To view our published articles, get in touch with us, or learn more about us, visit chariotonline.wordpress.com.

The Muse.desc: The Muse is a book club for Gunn students to get together, read, and discuss a book of their choosing each month.

The Music Studio.desc: The Music Studio Club is the best jam avenue for students at Gunn; this club is open to all musicians: beat-makers, instrumentalists, vocalists, and songwriters, who will collaborate together and have a chance to get involved in the complete production of music. Non musician music enthusiasts are welcome too! The production environment is not stressful and students can bring creative ideas! Several genres will be welcomed and there will be a focus on hip-hop, R&B, jazz, and fusion! Students will have access to guest speaker events and find cool opportunities to enrich their musical journeys. Hop into the studio, record a trumpet lick, write some bars, program drums, add 808s and drop the tracks!

The Village Studio.desc: The Village Studio is Gunn's makerspace, open to all students and faculty, with free access to arts and crafts materials, 3D printers, laser cutters, and more. We bring together minds from all disciplinary fields and help foster creativity through project-based learning, unstructured curricula, and critical education.

The Writing Club.desc: Ever wanted to write a story, whether it be in the form of a novel or a poem or even just a few fluffy sentences?We are a group of students that love to write mostly anything and everything. So whether you have never written anything besides essays or are editing your second novel, we hope we’ll have something to help you on your way. This no-pressure-no-problems club is for anyone and everyone, so join and let's write some magic! Hope to see you there.

Thespian Club.desc: Thespian Club is a great place for people to make new friends, play epic theatre games, and more! No theatre experience is necessary to join!

TItan Science Journal Club.desc: The Titan Science Journal is a STEM-based magazine for high school students. The club works on publishing a quarterly journal. Members will help edit, compile, design, and manage the writing and publication process of the journal. Submissions are open to everyone. Meetings are held every other week and additional meeting will be held as we get closer to publication dates. Fundraisers will occur at least once a semester. Funds go towards printing and publishing costs.

Title IX Club.desc: We're dedicated to promoting sexual violence prevention at schools through advocacy. Throughout the year, members will be collaborating with local administrators and other community members on educational content, policy-writing, bringing guest speakers to campus, social media projects, and more! Title IX Club is open to everyone, whether you're a survivor, someone who is passionate about sexual violence prevention, or just interested in advocacy.

United Computations.desc: United Computations brings together a community of students with a common interest in computer science. We plan on inviting guest speakers to club meetings, holding beginner competitive programming lessons and delving into the various fields of computer science. Additionally, as members of United Computations, students can participate in organizing Gunn’s annual hackathon (GunnHacks 7.0). Anyone interested in computer science is welcome to join!

Vote16 Palo Alto @ Gunn.desc: The Gunn chapter for VOTE16, which is a program that works to lower the legal voting at to 16 and 17 year-olds. Our club would mostly consist of discussing upcoming events, strategies, planning civic engagement events for students, getting endorsements, and overall making real change in local government.

Voting Club.desc: Dedicated to voting encouragement and educate people on the importance of voting, especially for those with little to no prior voting experience or mindset. (ie. first generation immigrants, people who just turned 18, etc).Primary objective: get people to vote!Activities include: Strategy discussion, phone banking, create advertisement on the importance of voting. Potentially: give speeches to audiences during events.

Women in STEM Club.desc: The Women in STEM Club aims to cultivate a friendly, welcoming environment for young women, while encouraging girls who are interested in pursuing a career in STEM. Meetings will take place every other week and will include various activities to empower young women to follow their passions in STEM. At our club, we will introduce unique, underrepresented STEM careers, expose our members to different STEM competitions, and invite female speakers currently pursuing STEM careers in the real world. Plus, we will learn the science behind fun, interactive activities including ice cream making and diy bath bombs (and so much more)!

Youth Community Service - Interact (YCS-.desc: Youth Community Service - Interact (YCS-I) is a community service club that works with the community organization, YCS, and the international program, Interact, to try and improve our community. Some of the events we put on are Service Day, Service Fair, Service Trip, and an Open Mic. We also regularly update club members on different community service opportunities as we are notified about them.
